text.0: let none swift travellers check you come hither likespirited stay not far away.
text.1: ye benders even of what is firm.
text.2: maruts Ṛbhukṣans rudras come ye with your cars strongfellied and exceeding bright.
text.3: come ye for whom we long with food to sacrifice come ye with love to sobbari.
text.4: for well we know the vigorous might of rudras sons the martits who are passing strong.
text.5: swift viṣṇus band who send the rain.
text.6: islands are bursting forth and misery is stayed the heaven and earth are joined in one.
text.7: decked with bright rings ye spread the broad expanses out when ye self luminous stirred yourselves.
text.8: even things immovable shake and reel the mountains and the forest trees at your approach.
text.9: and the earth trembles as ye come.
text.10: to lend free course o maruts to your furious rush heaven high and higher still gives way.
text.11: where they the heroes mighty with their arms display their gleaming omaments on their forms.
text.12: after their godlike nature they the bull like heroes dazzling and impetuous wear.
text.13: great splendour as they show erect.
text.14: the pivot of the sobharis chariot within the golden box is balmed with milk.
text.15: may they the wellborn mighty kindred of the cow aid us to food and to delight.
text.16: bring ye who sprinkle balmy drops oblations to your vigorous marut company.
text.17: to those whose leader is the bull.
text.18: come hither o ye mares on your stronghorsed car solid in look with solid naves.
text.19: lightly like winged falcons o ye heroes come come to enjoy our ofrerings.
text.20: their decoration is the same their omaments of gold are bright upon their arms.
text.22: they toil not to defend their bodies from attack strong heroes with their mighty arms.
text.23: strong are your bows and strong the weapons in your cars and glory sits on every face.
text.24: whose name extendeth like a sea alone resplendent so that all have joy in it.

text.27: of these loud roarers none is last this is their power this moves them to give mighty gifts.
text.28: blest by your favouring help was he o maruts at the earlier flushings of the morn.
text.29: and even now shall he be blest.
text.30: the strong man to whose sacrifice o heroes ye approach that ye may taste thereof.
text.31: with glories and with war that winneth spoil shall gain great bliss ye shakers of the world.
text.32: even as rudras sons the brood of the creator dyaus the asura desire.
text.33: o youthful ones so shall it be.
text.34: and these the bounteous worthy of the maruts who move onward pouring down the rain.
text.35: even for their sake o youthful ones with kindest heart take us to you to be your own.
text.36: o sobhari with newest song sing out unto the youthful purifying bulls.
text.37: even as a plougher to his steers.
text.38: who like a celebrated boxer overcome the challengers in every fight.
text.39: they who like shining bulls are most illustrioushonour those maruts with thy song.
text.40: allied by common ancestry ye maruts even the cows alike in energy.
text.41: lick all by turns each others head.
text.42: even mortal man ye dancers breast adorned with gold attains to brotherhood with you.

text.45: ye coursers who are friends to us.
